byline.contributor: Austin Ramzy contributed reporting from Hong Kong. Kiki Zhao, Vanessa Piao, Cherie Chan, Adam Wu and Yufan Huang contributed research from Beijing.

abstract: Capsizing of Chinese cruise ship Oriental Star in Yangtze River during period of heavy rain and thunderstorms raises question as to why ship's captain, Zhang Shunwen, did not heed maritime bureau weather warnings and anchor boat; government authorities have detained captain since his rescue and have provided few details about incident.
lead_paragraph: At least two vessels on the Yangtze River on Monday dropped anchor after a warning about stormy weather, but the Oriental Star sailed on, and capsized.

headline.main: Decisions by Captain in Yangtze Ship Disaster Come Under Scrutiny
headline.print_headline: In Yangtze Disaster, Doubts on Captain’s Judgment
